title: Introduction to the Survey Solutions API package
text: World Bank’s Computer Assisted Survey System (CASS) Survey Solutions powerful tool high quality data collection used many statistical offices around world. Besides standard GUI, also comes powerful REST API. details see https://support.mysurvey.solutions/ facilitate integration fully automated workflow developed R package, covers almost available API calls. vignette get first overview different functions, vignettes available survey management, paradata analysis shiny integration. package can considered API “bare bone”, implements basic Survey Solutions API calls without substantial modification. However, true data export function well paradata. Modification necessary facilitate workflow integration. See details corresponding documentation. Please aware, package makes heavy use data.table, also continued vignette. case familiar yet, probably look introduction.

title: Introduction to the Survey Solutions API package
text: use API first need set-API user Survey Solutions server. See details. done, can use suso_set_key() function, provide credentials. done, need provide credentials every API call . stored end current session. also function check credentials work. case workspace provided, call (like calls) default primary workspace. However workspace provided, check performed provided workspace. calls supervisor API, returns response. return value 200, connection credentials OK. information API response status codes look : https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/HTTP/Status.
code: library(SurveySolutionsAPI) suso_clear_keys() suso_set_key("https://xxx.mysurvey.solutions", "xxxxxx", "xxxxxxx") suso_keys() #> $suso #> $suso$susoServer #> [1] "https://xxx.mysurvey.solutions" #>  #> $suso$susoUser #> [1] "xxxxxx" #>  #> $suso$susoPass #> [1] "xxxxxxx" #>  #>  #> attr(,"class") #> [1] "suso_api" suso_PwCheck() #> [1] "https://michael-wild-demo.mysurvey.solutions/primary/api/v1/supervisors?limit=200" #> Response [https://michael-wild-demo.mysurvey.solutions/primary/api/v1/supervisors?limit=200] #>   Date: 2023-02-16 17:24 #>   Status: 200 #>   Content-Type: application/json; charset=utf-8 #>   Size: 482 B suso_PwCheck(workspace = "test") #> [1] "https://michael-wild-demo.mysurvey.solutions/test/api/v1/supervisors?limit=200" #> Response [https://michael-wild-demo.mysurvey.solutions/test/api/v1/supervisors?limit=200] #>   Date: 2023-02-16 17:24 #>   Status: 200 #>   Content-Type: application/json; charset=utf-8 #>   Size: 4.54 kB

title: Introduction to the Survey Solutions API package
text: can also manage workspaces API. particular, can request list workspaces API user access , well create new workspaces assign users particular workspace. However latter two operations require ADMIN credentials. Standard API user credentials work. receive list workspaces current API user access , can just run: receive list workspaces system (even current API user access ) can , use ADMIN password: next two operations, use admin credentials mandatory, work standard API user. first one two creation new workspace: return value function already tells , new workspace successfully created, however double check, can also get full list : Finally can also assign new user workspace using suso_assignWorkspace function. details workspaces can found dedicated vignette user management.
code: ws <- suso_getWorkspace() print(head(ws)) #>       Name       DisplayName DisabledAtUtc #> 1: primary Default Workspace            NA #> 2:    test              test            NA #> 3:   test2             test2            NA ws <- suso_getWorkspace(apiUser = adminUser, apiPass = adminPass) #> Error in stopifnot(is.character(user), length(user) == 1): object 'adminUser' not found print(head(ws)) #>       Name       DisplayName DisabledAtUtc #> 1: primary Default Workspace            NA #> 2:    test              test            NA #> 3:   test2             test2            NA ws <- suso_createWorkspace(apiUser = adminUser, apiPass = adminPass, your_workspace = "test", new_workspace = "test11", displayName = "ExtraExtraWorkspace") #> Error in stopifnot(is.character(user), length(user) == 1): object 'adminUser' not found print(head(ws)) #>       Name       DisplayName DisabledAtUtc #> 1: primary Default Workspace            NA #> 2:    test              test            NA #> 3:   test2             test2            NA ws <- suso_getWorkspace(apiUser = adminUser, apiPass = adminPass) #> Error in stopifnot(is.character(user), length(user) == 1): object 'adminUser' not found print(head(ws)) #>       Name       DisplayName DisabledAtUtc #> 1: primary Default Workspace            NA #> 2:    test              test            NA #> 3:   test2             test2            NA ws <- suso_assignWorkspace(your_workspace = "test", assign_workspace = "test11", apiUser = adminUser, apiPass = adminPass, uid = "34c2bc7b-ec33-473b-875b-dc06d269fced", sv_id = "34c2bc7b-ec33-473b-875b-dc06d269fced") #> Error in stopifnot(is.character(user), length(user) == 1): object 'adminUser' not found print(head(ws)) #>       Name       DisplayName DisabledAtUtc #> 1: primary Default Workspace            NA #> 2:    test              test            NA #> 3:   test2             test2            NA

title: Introduction to the Survey Solutions API package

title: Introduction to the Survey Solutions API package
text: retrieve paradata particular interview use suso_export_paradata return list data.tables, separated events. Please bear mind, paradata files can fairly big, processing may require large working memory. decrease load also 3 parameters can change, : onlyActiveEvents, TRUE processes active events initiated users. allResponses, FALSE, process response values, nevertheless still included single column. Otherwise, separated column. Running call without passive events without responses processed, reduces processing time significantly. see system timings, changing parameters reduces processing time significantly. details work paradata can found corresponding vignette. paradata export returned list, following elements: full data: KeyAssigned, Completed, AnswerSet, AnswerRemoved, Restarted, Reject, QuestionDeclaredInvalid, QuestionDeclaredValid, actionDistr, userDistr, roleDistr reduced data: KeyAssigned, Completed, AnswerSet, AnswerRemoved, Restarted, Reject, actionDistr, userDistr, roleDistr also tables already included file, like: gives distribution events user, : gives distribution event type.
code: system.time(para1 <- suso_export_paradata(questID = questlist[1, QuestionnaireId], workspace = "test", version = questlist[1, Version], reloadTimeDiff = 24, onlyActiveEvents = F, allResponses = T)) #>  #> The last file has been created 1 hours ago. #>  #> Starting download & file extraction.  #>  #>  #> Calculating Response Timings. #>  #> Extracting GPS variable. #> Processing:  #>  AnswerSet #>  #>  AnswerRemoved #>  #>  ApproveByHeadquarter #>  #>  Restarted #>  #>  Reject #>  #>  QuestionDeclaredInvalid #>  #>  QuestionDeclaredValid #>  #> Export & Transformation finished. #>    user  system elapsed  #>   0.536   0.036   0.820 system.time(para2 <- suso_export_paradata(questID = questlist[1, QuestionnaireId], workspace = "test", version = questlist[1, Version], reloadTimeDiff = 24, onlyActiveEvents = T, allResponses = F)) #>  #> The last file has been created 1 hours ago. #>  #> Starting download & file extraction.  #>  #>  #> Calculating Response Timings. #>  #> Extracting GPS variable. #> Processing:  #>  AnswerSet #>  #>  AnswerRemoved #>  #>  ApproveByHeadquarter #>  #>  Restarted #>  #>  Reject #>  #> Export & Transformation finished. #>    user  system elapsed  #>   0.524   0.028   0.818 para2[["userDistr"]] #>    responsible count #> 1:               918 #> 2:        int1   804 para2[["actionDistr"]] #>                      action count #>  1:   QuestionDeclaredValid   747 #>  2:               AnswerSet   646 #>  3:             VariableSet   129 #>  4:                 Resumed    25 #>  5:                  Paused    25 #>  6:     TranslationSwitched    23 #>  7:             KeyAssigned    17 #>  8:        InterviewCreated    17 #>  9:      SupervisorAssigned    17 #> 10:    InterviewModeChanged    17 #> 11:     InterviewerAssigned    17 #> 12:               Completed    17 #> 13:    ReceivedBySupervisor    16 #> 14: QuestionDeclaredInvalid     9

Calculates response time  separtes multiple responses individual columns. also creates variable  counter preserves sequence events. return value list separate list element event. variable names contains gps function also attempts identify (extract) geo-reference location. case multiple gps variables, identifies first variable, missing values. turn facilitates creation paradata maps (see vignette paradata). addition also returns variables responses separate columns factors. Exporting onlyActiveEvents substantially decrease processing time. events may sufficient paradata analysis. decrease processing time, one set allResponses FALSE. still export data, however attempt extract responses setting factors.

title: Set Credentials — suso_set_key
text: Use suso_set_key make API keys available suso_ functions, need specify credentials parameter within functions. server address can provided without https:\ suffix, nevertheless missing, suffix added. case suso_token provided, token authentication attempted. details token authentication Survey Solutions please see https://docs.mysurvey.solutions/headquarters/accounts/token-based-authentication/.
